Package sailpoint.reporting.datasource

Interface LiveReportDataSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRDataSource, sailpoint.reporting.datasource.TopLevelDataSource
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    JavaDataSource
    public interface LiveReportDataSource
extends sailpoint.reporting.datasource.TopLevelDataSource
    Extension of the TopLevelDataSource interface that allows us to execute the datasource outside of Jasper and allows us to get an idea of the size of the data source's dataset.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getBaseHql()
      Returns the base hql string for this report.
      QueryOptions getBaseQueryOptions()
      Returns the base QueryOptions for this report.
      java.lang.Object getFieldValue​(java.lang.String field)
      This method should work exactly like getFieldValue defined in JRDatasource, with the exception that we can pass a field name string rather than a JRField object.
      int getSizeEstimate()
      Returns the number of rows in the dataset this data source will return.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRDataSource

        getFieldValue, next

      • Methods inherited from interface sailpoint.reporting.datasource.TopLevelDataSource

        close, setMonitor

    • Method Detail

      • getSizeEstimate

        int getSizeEstimate()
             throws GeneralException
        Returns the number of rows in the dataset this data source will return.
        Returns:
        Number of rows in this datasource
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getBaseQueryOptions

        QueryOptions getBaseQueryOptions()
        Returns the base QueryOptions for this report. This is used when generating a chart for the report. When creating the baseQueryOptions, the paging parameters (resultLimit and firstRow) should be null.

      • getBaseHql

        java.lang.String getBaseHql()
        Returns the base hql string for this report. This is used by to create a chart based on the report data. This can be null if no chart is needed.

      • getFieldValue

        java.lang.Object getFieldValue​(java.lang.String field)
                        throws GeneralException
        This method should work exactly like getFieldValue defined in JRDatasource, with the exception that we can pass a field name string rather than a JRField object. This is used in cases where we want to evaluate the datasource outside of a Jasper context.
        Parameters:
        field - Name of the field to retrieve from the datasource.
        Returns:
        Field value
        Throws:
        GeneralException
